Resources.Name: Official React Docs
Resources.Description: Use these react docs as a starting point to learn the basics of react

Resources.Name: Next.JS React Docs
Resources.Description: More informative react documentation from Next.js on how to deploy your react app

Resources.Name: Firebase documentation
Resources.Description: Resource that covers all of the basics; explores different firebase offerings and how you can integrate them into your app

Resources.Name: Tutorial that walks you through how to add “Login with Google/FB/etc” into your react app
Resources.Description: How to integrate Firebase auth into your React app

Resources.Name: Firebase tutorial for several features
Resources.Description: Learn how to use Firestore and integrate it into your app, a NoSQL database

Resources.Name: Unity Documentation
Resources.Description: A documentation that covers information about how to use Unity Editor, Unity scripting, and assets

Resources.Name: WebGL
Resources.Description: You can deploy your Unity games or projects in a web format. A website that hosts your projects is itch.io

Resources.Name: Getting started with Unity
Resources.Description: The most basic tutorial that walks through everything needed for making a simple game

Resources.Name: Three.js Documentation
Resources.Description: Interested in incorporting 3D models and objects on your website? Check out Three.js

Resources.Name: Getting started with Three.js and integrate it on a website
Resources.Description: Tutorial that walks you through how to make your first webpage with three.js incorporated

Resources.Name: Three.js examples
Resources.Description: Examples (with code) that used Three.js. You can also check out the code being used for creating these examples by clicking the “< >” icon

Resources.Name: NuxtJS Documentation
Resources.Description: If you’ve never used React, Vue and Nuxt is probably easier to get started with than using React/Next. Script tags are extremely intuitive, and it “just works” by using directories.

Resources.Name: Tailwind
Resources.Description: App.hackwashu.com was built with nuxt using tailwind for css styles and makes it easy to make websites look good

Resources.Name: DaisyUI
Resources.Description: App.hackwashu.com was built with Daisy UI that has a lot of ui icons to plug in to your website

Resources.Name: PhosphorIcons
Resources.Description: App.hackwashu.com uses phosphor icons for company logos

Resources.Name: Figma
Resources.Description: Figma is a great design tool to mock up your website before your start building it in code

Resources.Name: Supabase
Resources.Description: There are getting started guides for virtually every framework. After poking through them all, it’s by far the easiest to get started with Nuxt (sorry Next fans)
